summary:
"Rashomon" is a 1950 Japanese movie directed by Akira Kurosawa. It's about a samurai's murder, told from different people's perspectives. Each person's story is different, showing how memories and lies can change the truth. The film is based on Ryūnosuke Akutagawa's stories "In a Grove" and "Rashōmon."

Kurosawa used new filming techniques, like pointing the camera at the sun. The movie was a hit at the Venice Film Festival and won an Academy Award. Today, "Rashomon" is seen as one of the best movies ever made, famous for showing how people can see the same event in different ways.
title: Rashomon
